Basic package workflow

Source: vignettes/steppedwedge.Rmd
steppedwedge.Rmd

library(steppedwedge)

The load_data function takes in raw data and creates a data object that can be accepted by the plot_design and analyze functions. We use the made-up dataframe sw_data_example to demonstrate the workflow.


data(sw_data_example)
head(sw_data_example)
#>   cluster period trt outcome_bin outcome_cont
#> 1       1      1   0           0    2.0629668
#> 2       1      1   0           0    1.2942290
#> 3       1      1   0           0   -2.2027975
#> 4       1      1   0           0    0.7933190
#> 5       1      1   0           0   -0.8249006
#> 6       1      1   0           0   -0.8456510

dat <- load_data(
  time = "period",
  cluster_id = "cluster",
  individual_id = NULL,
  treatment = "trt",
  outcome = "outcome_bin",
  data = sw_data_example
)
#> Error in get(paste0(generic, ".", class), envir = get_method_env()) : 
#>   object 'type_sum.accel' not found
#> Stepped wedge dataset loaded. Discrete time design with 15 clusters, 5 sequences, and 6 time points. 0/2011 rows were dropped due to missing values for `cluster_id`, `time`, `treatment`, or `outcome`.

The plot_design function produces a diagram of the stepped wedge design and a summary of the variables.


plot_dat <- plot_design(dat)

print(plot_dat)
#> $design_plot

The analyze function analyzes the stepped wedge data. First, we analyze the data using a mixed effects model, with the Time Average Treament Effect (TATE) as the estimand, assuming an Immediate Treatment (IT) effect, passing the family = "binomial" and link = "logit" arguments to glmer.


analysis_1 <- analyze(
  dat = dat,
  method = "mixed",
  estimand = "TATE", 
  exp_time = "IT",
  family = binomial
)
#> boundary (singular) fit: see help('isSingular')

print(analysis_1)
#> $model
#> Generalized linear mixed model fit by maximum likelihood (Laplace
#>   Approximation) [glmerMod]
#>  Family: binomial  ( logit )
#> Formula: outcome ~ factor(time) - 1 + treatment + (1 | cluster_id) + (1 |  
#>     ij)
#>    Data: dat
#>       AIC       BIC    logLik  deviance  df.resid 
#>  2056.801  2107.259 -1019.401  2038.801      2002 
#> Random effects:
#>  Groups     Name        Std.Dev.
#>  ij         (Intercept) 0       
#>  cluster_id (Intercept) 0       
#> Number of obs: 2011, groups:  ij, 90; cluster_id, 15
#> Fixed Effects:
#> factor(time)1  factor(time)2  factor(time)3  factor(time)4  factor(time)5  
#>       -1.3112        -1.2324        -1.1561        -1.2134        -1.4488  
#> factor(time)6      treatment  
#>       -1.1974        -0.1969  
#> optimizer (Nelder_Mead) convergence code: 0 (OK) ; 0 optimizer warnings; 1 lme4 warnings 
#> 
#> $model_type
#> [1] "it_mixed"
#> 
#> $estimand
#> [1] "TATE/LTE"
#> 
#> $te_est
#> [1] -0.1969021
#> 
#> $te_se
#> [1] 0.15157
#> 
#> $te_ci
#> [1] -0.4939792  0.1001751
#> 
#> $converged
#> [1] TRUE

Repeat the analysis, but using GEE rather than a mixed model.


analysis_2 <- analyze(
  dat = dat,
  method = "GEE",
  estimand = "TATE", 
  exp_time = "IT",
  family = binomial,
  corstr = "exchangeable"
)

print(analysis_2)
#> $model
#> 
#> Call:
#> geepack::geeglm(formula = stats::as.formula(formula), family = family, 
#>     data = dat, id = cluster_id, corstr = corstr)
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#> factor(time)1 factor(time)2 factor(time)3 factor(time)4 factor(time)5 
#>    -1.3012485    -1.2460497    -1.1532034    -1.2270617    -1.4579805 
#> factor(time)6     treatment 
#>    -1.1802214    -0.2013981 
#> 
#> Degrees of Freedom: 2011 Total (i.e. Null);  2004 Residual
#> 
#> Scale Link:                   identity
#> Estimated Scale Parameters:  [1] 1.002224
#> 
#> Correlation:  Structure = exchangeable    Link = identity 
#> Estimated Correlation Parameters:
#>        alpha 
#> -0.004809356 
#> 
#> Number of clusters:   15   Maximum cluster size: 153 
#> 
#> 
#> $model_type
#> [1] "it_GEE"
#> 
#> $estimand
#> [1] "TATE/LTE"
#> 
#> $te_est
#> [1] -0.2013981
#> 
#> $te_se
#> [1] 0.08027659
#> 
#> $te_ci
#> [1] -0.35874021 -0.04405599

Mixed model, with Time Average Treament Effect (TATE) as the estimand, using an Exposure Time Indicator (ETI) model.


analysis_3 <- analyze(
  dat = dat,
  method = "mixed",
  estimand = "TATE", 
  exp_time = "ETI",
  family = binomial
)
#> boundary (singular) fit: see help('isSingular')

print(analysis_3)
#> $model
#> Generalized linear mixed model fit by maximum likelihood (Laplace
#>   Approximation) [glmerMod]
#>  Family: binomial  ( logit )
#> Formula: 
#> outcome ~ factor(time) - 1 + factor(exposure_time) + (1 | cluster_id) +  
#>     (1 | ij)
#>    Data: dat
#>       AIC       BIC    logLik  deviance  df.resid 
#>  2059.742  2132.625 -1016.871  2033.742      1998 
#> Random effects:
#>  Groups     Name        Std.Dev.
#>  ij         (Intercept) 2e-07   
#>  cluster_id (Intercept) 0e+00   
#> Number of obs: 2011, groups:  ij, 90; cluster_id, 15
#> Fixed Effects:
#>          factor(time)1           factor(time)2           factor(time)3  
#>                -1.3112                 -1.2250                 -1.1204  
#>          factor(time)4           factor(time)5           factor(time)6  
#>                -1.2653                 -1.4862                 -1.1686  
#> factor(exposure_time)1  factor(exposure_time)2  factor(exposure_time)3  
#>                -0.2484                 -0.3230                  0.1501  
#> factor(exposure_time)4  factor(exposure_time)5  
#>                -0.2509                 -0.4408  
#> optimizer (Nelder_Mead) convergence code: 0 (OK) ; 0 optimizer warnings; 1 lme4 warnings 
#> 
#> $model_type
#> [1] "eti_mixed"
#> 
#> $estimand
#> [1] "TATE"
#> 
#> $te_est
#> [1] -0.2225999
#> 
#> $te_se
#> [1] 0.180177
#> 
#> $te_ci
#> [1] -0.5757468  0.1305470
#> 
#> $converged
#> [1] TRUE

Mixed model, with Time Average Treatment Effect (TATE) as the estimand, using a Natural Cubic Splines (NCS) model.


analysis_4 <- analyze(
  dat = dat,
  method = "mixed",
  estimand = "TATE", 
  exp_time = "NCS",
  family = binomial
)
#> boundary (singular) fit: see help('isSingular')

print(analysis_4)
#> $model
#> Generalized linear mixed model fit by maximum likelihood (Laplace
#>   Approximation) [glmerMod]
#>  Family: binomial  ( logit )
#> Formula: outcome ~ factor(time) - 1 + b1 + b2 + b3 + b4 + (1 | cluster_id) +  
#>     (1 | ij)
#>    Data: dat
#>       AIC       BIC    logLik  deviance  df.resid 
#>  2059.624  2126.901 -1017.812  2035.624      1999 
#> Random effects:
#>  Groups     Name        Std.Dev. 
#>  ij         (Intercept) 3.972e-07
#>  cluster_id (Intercept) 0.000e+00
#> Number of obs: 2011, groups:  ij, 90; cluster_id, 15
#> Fixed Effects:
#> factor(time)1  factor(time)2  factor(time)3  factor(time)4  factor(time)5  
#>     -1.311174      -1.216164      -1.129472      -1.237023      -1.488449  
#> factor(time)6             b1             b2             b3             b4  
#>     -1.163324      -0.001176       0.203676      -0.751609      -0.251060  
#> optimizer (Nelder_Mead) convergence code: 0 (OK) ; 0 optimizer warnings; 1 lme4 warnings 
#> 
#> $model_type
#> [1] "ncs_mixed"
#> 
#> $estimand
#> [1] "TATE"
#> 
#> $te_est
#> [1] -0.231144
#> 
#> $te_se
#> [1] 0.1801249
#> 
#> $te_ci
#> [1] -0.5841887  0.1219008
#> 
#> $converged
#> [1] TRUE

Mixed model, with Time Average Treament Effect (TATE) as the estimand, using a Treatment Effect Heterogeneity over exposure time (TEH) model.


analysis_5 <- analyze(
  dat = dat,
  method = "mixed",
  estimand = "TATE", 
  exp_time = "TEH",
  family = binomial
)
#> boundary (singular) fit: see help('isSingular')

print(analysis_5)
#> $model
#> Generalized linear mixed model fit by maximum likelihood (Laplace
#>   Approximation) [glmerMod]
#>  Family: binomial  ( logit )
#> Formula: 
#> outcome ~ factor(time) - 1 + treatment + (0 + treatment | exposure_time) +  
#>     (1 | cluster_id) + (1 | ij)
#>    Data: dat
#>       AIC       BIC    logLik  deviance  df.resid 
#>  2058.801  2114.865 -1019.401  2038.801      2001 
#> Random effects:
#>  Groups        Name        Std.Dev.
#>  ij            (Intercept) 0       
#>  cluster_id    (Intercept) 0       
#>  exposure_time treatment   0       
#> Number of obs: 2011, groups:  ij, 90; cluster_id, 15; exposure_time, 6
#> Fixed Effects:
#> factor(time)1  factor(time)2  factor(time)3  factor(time)4  factor(time)5

Continuous outcome

Mixed model, with Time Average Treament Effect (TATE) as the estimand, using a Natural Cubic Splines (NCS) model.


analysis_6 <- analyze(
  dat = dat,
  method = "mixed",
  estimand = "TATE", 
  exp_time = "NCS",
  family = gaussian
)
#> boundary (singular) fit: see help('isSingular')

print(analysis_6)
#> $model
#> Linear mixed model fit by REML ['lmerMod']
#> Formula: outcome ~ factor(time) - 1 + b1 + b2 + b3 + b4 + (1 | cluster_id) +  
#>     (1 | ij)
#>    Data: dat
#> REML criterion at convergence: 2106.325
#> Random effects:
#>  Groups     Name        Std.Dev.
#>  ij         (Intercept) 0.0193  
#>  cluster_id (Intercept) 0.0000  
#>  Residual               0.4040  
#> Number of obs: 2011, groups:  ij, 90; cluster_id, 15
#> Fixed Effects:
#> factor(time)1  factor(time)2  factor(time)3  factor(time)4  factor(time)5  
#>     0.2122328      0.2288284      0.2429516      0.2251247      0.1866313  
#> factor(time)6             b1             b2             b3             b4  
#>     0.2366950     -0.0004316      0.0306920     -0.1182628     -0.0373855  
#> optimizer (nloptwrap) convergence code: 0 (OK) ; 0 optimizer warnings; 1 lme4 warnings 
#> 
#> $model_type
#> [1] "ncs_mixed"
#> 
#> $estimand
#> [1] "TATE"
#>

#> [1] -0.03648381
#> 
#> $te_se
#> [1] 0.02953074
#> 
#> $te_ci
#> [1] -0.09436405  0.02139644
